1.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

2.brief: properly, to become pale, i.e. (by implication) to pine after; also to fear
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
near, with or among; often in general, to
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

3.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
the swift, a kind of swallow
a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to place (in a very wide application)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

4.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

5.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
a thoroughfare (as turnpiked), literally or figuratively; specifically a viaduct, a staircase
the heart (as the most interior organ);

6.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a fountain (also collectively), figuratively, a source (of satisfaction)
to place (in a very wide application)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to wrap, i.e. cover, veil, cloth, or roll
an archer; also teacher or teaching; also the early rain

7.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
near, with or among; often in general, to
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

9.brief: a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)
hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to gyrate (or move in a circle), i.e. to remain
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to debar (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth

12.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
